result.execSummary:
The defendant Earl Blackmon III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: With 61 days credit, CONCURRENT to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: - Obtain/maintain full-time work/school (minimum of 30 hours of work per week if in school).

- Complete 8 hours of in person driver's education.
- Obtain a valid driver's license.
- Complete a cognitive thinking program.
- Provide DNA sample.

supervisions.notes: - Court ordered the defendant to pay the DNA surcharge during the term of extended supervision. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment. Court waived all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to a finding of indigency.  If revoked from extended supervision, Court ordered that the DNA surcharge be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable and as a condition of extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
- Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never own or possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Earl Blackmon III

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Earl Blackmon III in court, in custody.  Attorney Connor Romenesko in court for Earl Blackmon III.  Attorney Stephanie Krueger in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea/sentencing.  Parties have reached an agreement.  Plea negotiations set forth on the record and agreed upon by the parties.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never own or possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Sentencing proceeded. Statements made by the State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 38 MONTHS with 61 days credit, CONCURRENT to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 14 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program. 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION: 
- Complete 8 hours of in person driver's education. 
- Obtain/maintain full-time work/school (minimum of 30 hours of work per week if in school). 
- Obtain a valid driver's license. 
- Complete 50 hours of community service.  
- Complete a cognitive thinking program.
- Provide DNA sample. 
 
- Restitution left open at this time.

Court ordered the defendant to pay the DNA surcharge during the term of extended supervision. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment. Court waived all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to a finding of indigency.  If revoked from extended supervision, Court ordered that the DNA surcharge be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable and as a condition of extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. 

20 day appeal rights given.
Received and Filed:  Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
Received and Filed: Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum.
Filed: Original Transcript of PRELIMINARY HEARING  (15 pages) commencing 04-11-2022, by KATHERINE M. NELSON.

Attorney Connor Romenesko in court, defendant Earl Blackmon not in court, in custody.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests a plea/sentencing date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Earl Blackmon in court with Attorney Connor Romenesko.  Defendant Earl Blackmon in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Whitefish Bay Officer M. Boivin. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.

Defendant Earl Blackmon in court with attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Earl Blackmon in custody.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Earl Blackmon appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.   DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY. 
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
